009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
020import imagingbook.common.math.eigen.GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * Algebraic ellipse fit based on Taubin's method [1]. Version 2 uses a reduced
025 * scatter and constraint matrix (5x5), the solution is found by generalized
026 * symmetric eigendecomposition. See [3, Sec. 11.2.1] for a detailed description
027 * (Alg. 11.8). This implementation performs data centering or, alternatively,
028 * accepts a specific reference point.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] G. Taubin, G. Taubin. "Estimation of planar curves, surfaces, and
032 * nonplanar space curves defined by implicit equations with applications to
033 * edge and range image segmentation", IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and
034 * Machine Intelligence 13(11), 1115â€“1138 (1991). <br>
035 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
036 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
037 * </p>
038 * 
039 * @author WB
040 * @version 2021/11/09
041 * @see EllipseFitTaubin1
042 */
043public class EllipseFitTaubin2 implements EllipseFitAlgebraic {
044        
045        private final double[] q;       // = (A,B,C,D,E,F) ellipse parameters
046        
047        public EllipseFitTaubin2(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
048                if (points.length < 5) {
049                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 5 points must be supplied for ellipse fitting");
050                }
051                this.q = fit(points, xref);
052        }
053        
054        public EllipseFitTaubin2(Pnt2d[] points) {
055                this(points, PntUtils.centroid(points));
056        }
057
058        @Override
059        public double[] getParameters() {
060                return this.q;
061        }
062        
063        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
066                final int n = points.length;
067                
068                // reference point
069                final double xr = xref.getX();
070                final double yr = xref.getY();
071
072                // design matrix (same as Fitzgibbon):
073                RealMatrix X = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(n, 6);
074                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
075                        final double x = points[i].getX() - xr; // center data set
076                        final double y = points[i].getY() - yr;
077                        double[] fi = {sqr(x), x*y, sqr(y), x, y, 1};
078                        X.setRow(i, fi);
079                }
080                
081                // scatter matrix S (normalized by 1/n)
082                RealMatrix S = X.transpose().multiply(X).scalarMultiply(1.0/n);
083                RealMatrix S1 = S.getSubMatrix(0, 4, 0, 4);
084                RealVector s5 = S.getColumnVector(5).getSubVector(0, 5);
085
086                RealMatrix P = S1.subtract(s5.outerProduct(s5));
087        
088                double a = S.getEntry(0, 5);
089                double b = S.getEntry(2, 5);
090                double c = S.getEntry(1, 5);
091                double d = S.getEntry(3, 5);
092                double e = S.getEntry(4, 5);
093                
094                // constraint matrix:
095                RealMatrix Q = Matrix.makeRealMatrix(5, 5, 
096                                4*a, 2*c, 0,   2*d, 0,
097                                2*c, a+b, 2*c, e,   d, 
098                                0,   2*c, 4*b, 0,   2*e,
099                                2*d, e,   0,   1,   0,
100                                0,   d,   2*e, 0,   1);
101                
102                GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition eigen = new GeneralizedSymmetricEigenDecomposition(P, Q);
103                
104                double[] evals = eigen.getRealEigenvalues();
105                
106                int k = getSmallestPositiveIdx(evals);                  
107                RealVector q0 = eigen.getEigenvector(k);
108                
109                double f = -s5.dotProduct(q0);
110                double[] qopt = q0.append(f).toArray();
111                
112                RealMatrix U = getDataOffsetCorrectionMatrix(xr, yr);
113                return U.operate(qopt);
114        }
115        
116        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
117        
118        private int getSmallestPositiveIdx(double[] x) {
119                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
120                int minidx = -1;
121                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
122                        if (x[i] >= 0 && x[i] < minval) {
123                                minval = x[i];
124                                minidx = i;
125                        }
126                }
127                return minidx;
128        }
129        
130}
